snippet: The proposal appeared to be an effort by the government to show good faith before a peace conference next week aimed at ending Syria’s civil war.
abstract: Syrian government proposes a cease-fire with rebel forces in the city of Aleppo and says it is willing to exchange detainee lists with the opposition to pave the way for a possible prisoner exchange; proposals appear to be an effort by the government to show good faith days before an international peace conference is to be convened in Switzerland.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu and Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The proposal appeared to be an effort by the government to show good faith before a peace conference next week aimed at ending Syria’s civil war.

headline.main: Syria Proposes Aleppo Cease-Fire as Opposition Weighs Attending Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Syria Proposes Aleppo Cease-Fire as Opposition Weighs Attending Peace Talks
